description.narrative: Core support will be granted based on the RAF and the strategic budget submitted by Artemida. The RAF is designed for 2020 - 2023. Almost the entire strategic cycle will be covered by Swedish support (implementation period is planed to be until June 2023). The objectives, indicators and measures of implementation are described clearly in the RAF and the institutional budget. Artemida Nongovernmental Organisation realises its mission by implementing the initiatives for protection of domestic violence victims, developing and implementing the programmes for assistance and counselling for domestic aggressors, and raising of awareness of the wide public and decision makers with regard of the phenomenon of domestic violence and ways of combating it. Artemida`s activity in the next four years (2020-2023) will focus on initiatives aiming to achieve the following results: 1. Increased protection (in the north of Moldova) of females and young females against domestic violence, by making them know and exercise their own rights. 2. Changed attitudes and behaviour of the domestic aggressors (males and females) (in the north of Moldova), who will refrain from the repeated aggressive behaviour towards their partners and family members. 3. Accessibility and quality of information and assistance services in the field of domestic violence for females, males, young females and young males, as improved in all regions of Moldova and provided by the specialist (duty holders) teams and local ONGs in the context of domestic violence prevention and combating. 4. Increased level of professionalism, financial sustainability and positive image of Artemida Nongovernmental Organisation in the north of Moldova and at the national level.

Sverige kommer att stödja Artemida, en civil organisation från Moldavien, för genomförandet av kärnstödsaktiviteter försedda av Artemida Strategiska plan och RAF under Juni 2020 – Maj 2023. Kärnstöd beviljas för att stärka den institutionella kapaciteten och för att stödja genomförandet av Artemida medellång sikt Strategisk plan 2020—2024 i bekämpning av våld i hem och könsrelaterat våld i Moldavien. Det huvudsakliga målet och förväntade resultat av kärnaktiviteterna är att Artemida bidrar med att bygga ett samhälle där människor kan leva fria från våld och övergrepp och är säkra och skyddade i deras familjer och relationer. Det här är det första kärnstödet som erbjuds till Artemida från Sverige. Under den förberedande processen för insatsen, så har Sida’s principer och centrala prioriteringar för samarbetet med civilsamhällesorganisationer diskuterats med partnern. Artemida ställer sig bakom Sidas gemensamma utgångspunkter för samarbete. Ambassaden tillsammans med Artemida kommer att ha en kontinuerlig, öppen och transparent dialog om etiska och andra värdebaserade frågor.

Sweden will support Artemida, a civil society organisation from Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by Artemida Strategic Plan and RAF during June 2020 - May 2023. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of Artemida medium term Strategic Plan 2020-2023 in fighting domestic and gender-based violence in Moldova. The main objective and expected result of core activities is that Artemida contributes to building a community where people live their life free of violence and abuse and are safe and protected in their families and relationships. This is the first core support offered to Artemid by Sweden. Principal values for Sida and cooperation partners were shared and discussed as guidance during initial consultations on the contribution/project between programme coordinator and organization. Artemida is open to endorse Sida's common starting points for cooperation. The Embassy, together with Artemida will have a continuous, open and transparent dialogue on ethical and other value based issues.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: Grant Agreement for Core support to Artemida
Decision on Contribution for Core Support to Artemida

description.narrative: During 2020, though the activity was very much affected by COVID-19 pandemic, Artemida managed to be flexible and ensure the implementation of all activities that were agreed in the Annual Activity Plan. The organisation adapted its operations: online, offline. The dialogue with all relevant regional stakeholders continued and the assistance to domestic violence victims was intensified due to the increased cases of domestic violence, victims that needed more support and lack of places in the usual shelters. Besides the focus of Artemida on provisions of the Strategy and achieving results in increased protection of women and girls, changes of attitude and behavior of family aggressors, improved accessibility and quality of assistance services, and capacity building of organisation, they also had to focus on other specific priorities. Most of the planned offline activities were carried out online. Specialized counseling services were also provided online only in more urgent cases when the lives of right holders were in danger were placed in a residential regime in compliance with protection measures against Covid 19. In addition, it were identified partners to support the organization's activities by providing protective equipment to be distributed to both centers specialists and multi disciplinary teams, community members so that during this period to ensure the interventions of specialists in identifying and assisting beneficiaries in a safe way. For Artemida, that managed the National Coalition grant during 2020, there were challenges determined by the management of the sub-granting process: insufficient human resources for grant management and limited time, high load, given that in March-August 2020, 30 grants were allocated from the Emergency Fund and the Grants Program for member organizations, different format of all grants (donors and conditions of application and reporting, different currency that led to exchange losses, etc.). This activity will be further monitored.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
